title: I think lock screen is a bad habit i'm getting into
body:
i have recently become a gangplank main and his combos seem better without lock screen but i don't know how to adjust please help
every time it try it it feels weird and it takes to long to move my mouse

replies.body:
alot of people will tell you playing free screen is essential, but realistically it adds a whole extra element of league to learn. 

Sure at really high levels lockscreen is a no no, but for most league players it'd probably just be better to leave it locked on.

A good solution for the casual player is dynamically locking their screen, i.e. when you aren't in direct combat use unlocked and remember to adjust your screen to look into the jungle or other lanes or to overview a teamfight before someone engages, and when you need to focus on your champion and individual mechanics, press the lockscreen key to bring your mechanics and skillshots into focus.

You don't lose much on champions that don't have hyper range poke or abilities, and at least this way you won't screw up your skillshots or randomly wave your view away from your champion and become a sitting duck.
Just unbind the button to lock, after a week you're used to it
